title: What was Leonardo da Vinci's personality? - Quora

response.answer_text: Leonardo would probably have been a sensitive, nature-loving person, with powerful spatial perception. The depth of expression in his paintings reflects this, although painting was only a small part of his life. He was primarily an inventor and a natural philosopher. He conducted dissections on corpses to understand the workings of the human body, and was the first to sketch a foetus in the womb. His work on optics is less known, but it was very influential, and would certainly have influenced his art. He could have been dyslexic; he wrote with his left hand in reverse script - or mirror script. He probably did this to protect his work from others, as it was potentially heretical at times. He has been called a procrastinator, in that he often left work unfinished, but this could also have been because he had so much going on at once that some of his commissions were shelved in favour of other things he probably found more urgent or fascinating. He was a true polymath, a product of his time. The Italian Renaissance produced such individuals because it was a time of enquiry and change, but coming as he did from such inauspicious beginnings (he was an illegitimate child from a broken family), Leonardo’s natural curiosity would surely have meant that he would make his mark regardless of the opportunities he had.
